pageContext.claim: “And I actually did business with [Mauricio Macri's] father. Great father. He was a friend a mine. And I purchased the West Side railroad yards, and it was a great job, a successful job. A very big job. One of the largest jobs in Manhattan. ”
pageContext.analysis: Trump did do business with Macri's father. The deal fell apart, costing the Macri family millions. The relationship deteriorated to the point where the elder Macri reportedly suspected Trump was responsible for his son's kidnapping. As for the West Side railroad, Trump was eventually forced to give up control of the project after a series of setbacks.
